intro: Metrosideros aurea, commonly known as the New Zealand Christmas tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows up to 8 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers, which bloom in dense clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a glossy green appearance. Native to New Zealand, it is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
